content: After the holocaust, Zalman was a counselor to a group of children who survived the war until 1946. In 1946 he arrived to Cyprus and stayed there for nine months. Later, he immigrated to Israel and served in the Palmach. He served in the independence war and was a member in the kibbutz Lohamey Hageta'ot. In 1953 he met his wife and today they have two
